messages.content: Can you review this description of diagrams and them create the diagrams?

content.text: Can you review this description of diagrams and them create the diagrams?

attachments.extracted_content:
Introduction

Designing a curriculum that promotes Post-Traumatic Growth (PTG) in a seamless and non-intrusive manner requires careful planning and visualization. Charts and diagrams can serve as powerful tools to conceptualize and implement these strategies effectively. Below are five detailed charts that help visualize the theoretical frameworks and practical applications discussed. Each chart is accompanied by an explanation of how it aids educators in integrating PTG-promoting elements into their curricula without detracting from core educational objectives.

1. Integrated Framework Diagram
Description:

Type of Chart: Multi-Layered Circular Diagram
Structure:
Center Circle: Self-Efficacy
Middle Ring: Twelve Strategies for Developing Self-Efficacy
Integrate Self-Efficacy into Existing Activities
Offer Mastery Experiences Through Scaffolding
Foster Collaborative Learning
Provide Positive and Constructive Feedback
Incorporate Goal Setting and Self-Monitoring
Model Self-Efficacious Behavior
Create a Positive Classroom Environment
Utilize Micro-Moments for Emotional Regulation
Encourage a Growth Mindset
Integrate Reflection into Learning
Provide Opportunities for Student Leadership
Leverage Technology Wisely
Outer Ring: Connections to PTG and Related Concepts
Resilience
Deliberate Rumination
Gratitude
Social Support
Narrative Reappraisal
Brutally Honest Optimism
Perceived Control
Coping Style
Strong Sense of Self
Visual Elements:
Arrows and Lines: Show the interconnections and bidirectional influences between self-efficacy, the strategies, and PTG-related factors.
Color Coding: Different colors for each ring to distinguish layers.
How It Helps in Curriculum Design:

Holistic Visualization: Presents a comprehensive view of how self-efficacy is central to both educational strategies and PTG outcomes.
Interconnectivity Emphasis: Illustrates how each strategy not only builds self-efficacy but also contributes to resilience and PTG.
Integration Blueprint: Helps educators see how PTG elements can be naturally embedded within existing teaching methods.
2. Strategy Implementation Flowchart
Description:

Type of Chart: Flowchart with Decision Points
Structure:
Starting Point: Curriculum Goals (Academic Objectives)
Branches for Each Strategy:
Decision Nodes: Questions guiding the selection of appropriate strategies based on class context (e.g., "Are students struggling with confidence?")
Process Steps: Specific activities or interventions (e.g., "Implement scaffolding for complex tasks").
Outcomes: Enhanced Self-Efficacy, Resilience, PTG
Visual Elements:
Directional Arrows: Indicate the flow from decisions to actions and outcomes.
Icons/Symbols: Represent different types of activities (e.g., group work, individual reflection).
How It Helps in Curriculum Design:

Decision-Making Aid: Assists educators in selecting strategies that best fit their students' needs without disrupting the curriculum.
Action-Oriented: Provides clear steps for implementation, making it easier to apply theoretical concepts in practice.
Outcome Focused: Keeps attention on desired outcomes like PTG and resilience, ensuring that activities are purposeful.
3. Reciprocal Determinism Triangle
Description:

Type of Chart: Triangular Model
Structure:
Vertices:
Personal Factors: Cognitions, emotions, beliefs.
Behavior: Actions, strategies employed by students.
Environmental Factors: Classroom setting, teacher behavior, peer interactions.
Central Element: Self-Efficacy at the center of the triangle.
Bidirectional Arrows: Indicate reciprocal influences among the three vertices and self-efficacy.
Overlay Elements:
Connections to PTG Factors: Lines connecting the vertices to PTG concepts like gratitude and coping style.
Annotations: Brief notes explaining how each vertex relates to resilience and PTG.
How It Helps in Curriculum Design:

Conceptual Clarity: Visualizes Social Cognitive Theory, making abstract concepts more accessible.
Strategic Alignment: Helps educators align their methods to influence personal, behavioral, and environmental factors.
Balanced Approach: Encourages a comprehensive strategy that doesn't overemphasize one area at the expense of others.
4. Curriculum Integration Matrix
Description:

Type of Chart: Matrix/Table
Structure:
Rows: Curriculum Subjects or Units (e.g., Mathematics, Science, Literature).
Columns: PTG-Promoting Strategies.
Cells: Specific activities or lesson plans that integrate a strategy within a subject.
Additional Features:
Indicators: Symbols or color codes to show which PTG factors are addressed (e.g., a heart for gratitude).
Notes Section: Space for educators to add comments or reflections.
How It Helps in Curriculum Design:

Practical Tool: Facilitates planning by providing a clear template to map strategies across subjects.
Comprehensive Coverage: Ensures that all strategies are considered and that PTG promotion is consistent throughout the curriculum.
Customization: Allows educators to tailor activities to their specific classroom context.
5. Self-Efficacy Development Timeline
Description:

Type of Chart: Timeline with Milestones
Structure:
Horizontal Axis: Time periods (e.g., weeks, months, semesters).
Vertical Markers: Key self-efficacy development milestones.
Annotations: Strategies implemented at each time point and associated PTG factors.
Visual Elements:
Progress Arrows: Show the growth trajectory of self-efficacy over time.
Milestone Icons: Represent significant events or achievements (e.g., presentations, group projects).
Feedback Loops: Indicate points for reflection and adjustment.
How It Helps in Curriculum Design:

Long-Term Vision: Aids in planning the gradual development of self-efficacy and PTG over the course of the curriculum.
Monitoring Tool: Allows educators to track progress and make timely interventions if necessary.
Integration with Curriculum: Aligns self-efficacy and PTG development with academic milestones, ensuring coherence.
How These Charts Assist in Designing PTG-Promoting Curriculum

Visual Clarity and Understanding:

The charts translate complex theoretical frameworks into digestible visual representations.
They help educators grasp how different components interact and contribute to PTG.
Strategic Planning:

By mapping strategies and outcomes, educators can plan lessons that naturally incorporate PTG elements.
The charts facilitate the alignment of academic objectives with personal development goals.
Non-Intrusive Integration:

The visual tools emphasize embedding PTG-promoting activities within standard teaching practices.
Educators can see how to incorporate these elements without overhauling existing curricula.
Customization and Flexibility:

The charts are adaptable to different educational contexts and subject matters.
Educators can modify the charts to fit their unique classroom dynamics and student needs.
Collaboration and Communication:

These visual aids can be shared among teaching staff for collaborative planning.
They provide a common language and reference point for discussing curriculum design.
Conclusion

Using these charts, educators can effectively design curricula that promote Post-Traumatic Growth by integrating self-efficacy-building strategies in a seamless and non-intrusive way. The visual representations serve as practical guides for embedding PTG elements into everyday teaching, ensuring that students benefit from a holistic educational experience that fosters resilience, personal growth, and academic success.

Implementing the Charts in Curriculum Design:

Step 1: Begin with the Integrated Framework Diagram to understand the overall connection between self-efficacy, strategies, and PTG factors.
Step 2: Use the Strategy Implementation Flowchart to decide which strategies are most appropriate for your classroom and how to implement them.
Step 3: Refer to the Reciprocal Determinism Triangle to ensure that personal, behavioral, and environmental factors are all considered in your approach.
Step 4: Populate the Curriculum Integration Matrix with specific activities, aligning them with both subject matter and PTG-promoting strategies.
Step 5: Plan the academic year using the Self-Efficacy Development Timeline, marking key milestones and adjusting as needed based on student progress.
By following these steps and utilizing the charts, educators can create a dynamic and supportive learning environment that promotes PTG while fulfilling academic requirements.

messages.content:
Certainly, I'd be happy to review the description of the diagrams and create them for you. Let me summarize the key points for each diagram and then create them one by one.

1. Integrated Framework Diagram

This is a multi-layered circular diagram with three main components:
- Center Circle: Self-Efficacy
- Middle Ring: 12 Strategies for Developing Self-Efficacy
- Outer Ring: Connections to PTG and Related Concepts

Let's create this diagram:

<antThinking>Creating a multi-layered circular diagram is a good candidate for an artifact. It's a complex, self-contained visual element that can be understood on its own and might be used in various contexts. This is a new request, so I'll create a new artifact with the identifier "integrated-framework-diagram".</antThinking>

<antArtifact identifier="integrated-framework-diagram" type="image/svg+xml" title="Integrated Framework Diagram">
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 500 500">
  <!-- Outer ring -->
  <circle cx="250" cy="250" r="240" fill="#e6f3ff" stroke="#333" stroke-width="2"/>
  
  <!-- Middle ring -->
  <circle cx="250" cy="250" r="160" fill="#b3d9ff" stroke="#333" stroke-width="2"/>
  
  <!-- Inner circle -->
  <circle cx="250" cy="250" r="80" fill="#4da6ff" stroke="#333" stroke-width="2"/>
  
  <!-- Center text -->
  <text x="250" y="260" font-family="Arial, sans-serif" font-size="20" text-anchor="middle" fill="#333">Self-Efficacy</text>
  
  <!-- Middle ring text -->
  <g font-family="Arial, sans-serif" font-size="10" fill="#333">
    <text x="250" y="100" text-anchor="middle" transform="rotate(-75 250 250)">Integrate Self-Efficacy</text>
    <text x="250" y="100" text-anchor="middle" transform="rotate(-45 250 250)">Offer Mastery Experiences</text>
    <text x="250" y="100" text-anchor="middle" transform="rotate(-15 250 250)">Foster Collaborative Learning</text>
    <text x="250" y="100" text-anchor="middle" transform="rotate(15 250 250)">Provide Feedback</text>
    <text x="250" y="100" text-anchor="middle" transform="rotate(45 250 250)">Incorporate Goal Setting</text>
    <text x="250" y="100" text-anchor="middle" transform="rotate(75 250 250)">Model Self-Efficacy</text>
    <text x="250" y="400" text-anchor="middle" transform="rotate(-75 250 250)">Create Positive Environment</text>
    <text x="250" y="400" text-anchor="middle" transform="rotate(-45 250 250)">Utilize Micro-Moments</text>
    <text x="250" y="400" text-anchor="middle" transform="rotate(-15 250 250)">Encourage Growth Mindset</text>
    <text x="250" y="400" text-anchor="middle" transform="rotate(15 250 250)">Integrate Reflection</text>
    <text x="250" y="400" text-anchor="middle" transform="rotate(45 250 250)">Student Leadership</text>
    <text x="250" y="400" text-anchor="middle" transform="rotate(75 250 250)">Leverage Technology</text>
  </g>
  
  <!-- Outer ring text -->
  <g font-family="Arial, sans-serif" font-size="12" fill="#333">
    <text x="250" y="20" text-anchor="middle">Resilience</text>
    <text x="480" y="250" text-anchor="middle">Deliberate Rumination</text>
    <text x="250" y="480" text-anchor="middle">Gratitude</text>
    <text x="20" y="250" text-anchor="middle">Social Support</text>
    <text x="100" y="100" text-anchor="middle">Narrative Reappraisal</text>
    <text x="400" y="100" text-anchor="middle">Brutally Honest Optimism</text>
    <text x="400" y="400" text-anchor="middle">Perceived Control</text>
    <text x="100" y="400" text-anchor="middle">Coping Style</text>
  </g>
  
  <!-- Connecting lines -->
  <g stroke="#333" stroke-width="1">
    <line x1="250" y1="90" x2="250" y2="170"/>
    <line x1="250" y1="330" x2="250" y2="410"/>
    <line x1="90" y1="250" x2="170" y2="250"/>
    <line x1="330" y1="250" x2="410" y2="250"/>
    <line x1="180" y1="180" x2="230" y2="230"/>
    <line x1="320" y1="180" x2="270" y2="230"/>
    <line x1="320" y1="320" x2="270" y2="270"/>
    <line x1="180" y1="320" x2="230" y2="270"/>
  </g>
</svg>
</antArtifact>

This diagram visualizes the Integrated Framework, showing how self-efficacy is at the center, surrounded by strategies for developing it, and how these connect to PTG-related concepts.

2. Strategy Implementation Flowchart

This is a flowchart with decision points, showing:
- Starting Point: Curriculum Goals
- Branches for Each Strategy
- Decision Nodes
- Process Steps
- Outcomes

Let's create this flowchart:

<antThinking>A flowchart is another good candidate for an artifact. It's a complex, self-contained visual element that can be understood on its own and might be used in various contexts. This is a new request, so I'll create a new artifact with the identifier "strategy-implementation-flowchart".</antThinking>

<antArtifact identifier="strategy-implementation-flowchart" type="image/svg+xml" title="Strategy Implementation Flowchart">
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 600 400">
  <!-- Start node -->
  <rect x="250" y="10" width="100" height="50" rx="10" fill="#4da6ff" stroke="#333" stroke-width="2"/>
  <text x="300" y="40" font-family="Arial, sans-serif" font-size="12" text-anchor="middle" fill="#fff">Curriculum Goals</text>
  
  <!-- Decision node -->
  <polygon points="300,80 340,120 300,160 260,120" fill="#ffd966" stroke="#333" stroke-width="2"/>
  <text x="300" y="125" font-family="Arial, sans-serif" font-size="10" text-anchor="middle">Students struggling with confidence?</text>
  
  <!-- Yes branch -->
  <rect x="100" y="180" width="120" height="60" rx="10" fill="#b6d7a8" stroke="#333" stroke-width="2"/>
  <text x="160" y="210" font-family="Arial, sans-serif" font-size="10" text-anchor="middle">Implement scaffolding for complex tasks</text>
  
  <!-- No branch -->
  <rect x="380" y="180" width="120" height="60" rx="10" fill="#b6d7a8" stroke="#333" stroke-width="2"/>
  <text x="440" y="210" font-family="Arial, sans-serif" font-size="10" text-anchor="middle">Foster collaborative learning</text>
  
  <!-- Outcome -->
  <rect x="250" y="300" width="100" height="50" rx="10" fill="#4da6ff" stroke="#333" stroke-width="2"/>
  <text x="300" y="325" font-family="Arial, sans-serif" font-size="12" text-anchor="middle" fill="#fff">Enhanced Self-Efficacy</text>
  
  <!-- Arrows -->
  <g stroke="#333" stroke-width="2" fill="none">
    <path d="M300,60 L300,80"/>
    <path d="M260,120 L100,120 L100,180"/>
    <path d="M340,120 L500,120 L500,180"/>
    <path d="M160,240 L160,280 L250,280 L250,300"/>
    <path d="M440,240 L440,280 L350,280 L350,300"/>
  </g>
  
  <!-- Yes/No labels -->
  <text x="200" y="115" font-family="Arial, sans-serif" font-size="12" fill="#333">Yes</text>
  <text x="400" y="115" font-family="Arial, sans-serif" font-size="12" fill="#333">No</text>
</svg>
</antArtifact>

This flowchart illustrates the decision-making process for implementing strategies based on student needs, leading to enhanced self-efficacy.

3. Reciprocal Determinism Triangle

This is a triangular model showing:
- Vertices: Personal Factors, Behavior, Environmental Factors
- Central Element: Self-Efficacy
- Bidirectional Arrows
- Overlay Elements: Connections to PTG Factors

Let's create this triangle model:

<antThinking>A triangular model with complex relationships is another good candidate for an artifact. It's a self-contained visual element that can be understood on its own and might be used in various contexts. This is a new request, so I'll create a new artifact with the identifier "reciprocal-determinism-triangle".</antThinking>

<antArtifact identifier="reciprocal-determinism-triangle" type="image/svg+xml" title="Reciprocal Determinism Triangle">
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 400 400">
  <!-- Triangle -->
  <polygon points="200,50 50,350 350,350" fill="#e6f3ff" stroke="#333" stroke-width="2"/>
  
  <!-- Vertices -->
  <circle cx="200" cy="50" r="40" fill="#4da6ff" stroke="#333" stroke-width="2"/>
  <circle cx="50" cy="350" r="40" fill="#4da6ff" stroke="#333" stroke-width="2"/>
  <circle cx="350" cy="350" r="40" fill="#4da6ff" stroke="#333" stroke-width="2"/>
  
  <!-- Center -->
  <circle cx="200" cy="250" r="50" fill="#ffd966" stroke="#333" stroke-width="2"/>
  
  <!-- Vertex labels -->
  <text x="200" y="55" font-family="Arial, sans-serif" font-size="12" text-anchor="middle" fill="#333">Personal Factors</text>
  <text x="50" y="355" font-family="Arial, sans-serif" font-size="12" text-anchor="middle" fill="#333">Behavior</text>
  <text x="350" y="355" font-family="Arial, sans-serif" font-size="12" text-anchor="middle" fill="#333">Environmental Factors</text>
  
  <!-- Center label -->
  <text x="200" y="255" font-family="Arial, sans-serif" font-size="14" text-anchor="middle" fill="#333">Self-Efficacy</text>
  
  <!-- Bidirectional arrows -->
  <g stroke="#333" stroke-width="2" fill="none" marker-end="url(#arrowhead)" marker-start="url(#arrowhead)">
    <path d="M190,90 L70,310"/>
    <path d="M210,90 L330,310"/>
    <path d="M90,350 L310,350"/>
  </g>
  
  <!-- Arrow definitions -->
  <defs>
    <marker id="arrowhead" markerWidth="10" markerHeight="7" refX="0" refY="3.5" orient="auto">
      <polygon points="0 0, 10 3.5, 0 7" fill="#333"/>
    </marker>
  </defs>
  
  <!-- PTG connections -->
  <g stroke="#ff7f50" stroke-width="1" stroke-dasharray="5,5">
    <line x1="200" y1="50" x2="200" y2="200"/>
    <line x1="50" y1="350" x2="150" y2="250"/>
    <line x1="350" y1="350" x2="250" y2="250"/>
  </g>
  
  <!-- PTG labels -->
  <text x="220" y="125" font-family="Arial, sans-serif" font-size="10" fill="#ff7f50">Gratitude</text>
  <text x="100" y="275" font-family="Arial, sans-serif" font-size="10" fill="#ff7f50">Coping Style</text>
  <text x="300" y="275" font-family="Arial, sans-serif" font-size="10" fill="#ff7f50">Social Support</text>
</svg>
</antArtifact>

This triangle model illustrates the reciprocal relationships between personal factors, behavior, and environmental factors, with self-efficacy at the center and connections to PTG factors.

4. Curriculum Integration Matrix

This is a matrix/table showing:
- Rows: Curriculum Subjects or Units
- Columns: PTG-Promoting Strategies
- Cells: Specific activities or lesson plans

Let's create this matrix:

<antThinking>A curriculum integration matrix is a good candidate for an artifact. It's a complex, self-contained visual element that can be understood on its own and might be used in various contexts. This is a new request, so I'll create a new artifact with the identifier "curriculum-integration-matrix".</antThinking>

<antArtifact identifier="curriculum-integration-matrix" type="image/svg+xml" title="Curriculum Integration Matrix">
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 600 400">
  <!-- Table structure -->
  <rect x="0" y="0" width="600" height="400" fill="#fff" stroke="#333" stroke-width="2"/>
  
  <!-- Header row -->
  <rect x="0" y="0" width="600" height="50" fill="#4da6ff"/>
  
  <!-- Column dividers -->
  <line x1="150" y1="0" x2="150" y2="400" stroke="#333" stroke-width="1"/>
  <line x1="300" y1="0" x2="300" y2="400" stroke="#333" stroke-width="1"/>
  <line x1="450" y1="0" x2="450" y2="400" stroke="#333" stroke-width="1"/>
  
  <!-- Row dividers -->
  <line x1="0" y1="50" x2="600" y2="50" stroke="#333" stroke-width="1"/>
  <line x1="0" y1="150" x2="600" y2="150" stroke="#333" stroke-width="1"/>
  <line x1="0" y1="250" x2="600" y2="250" stroke="#333" stroke-width="1"/>
  
  <!-- Headers -->
  <text x="75" y="30" font-family="Arial, sans-serif" font-size="14" text-anchor="middle" fill="#fff">Subject</text>
  <text x="225" y="30" font-family="Arial, sans-serif" font-size="14" text-anchor="middle" fill="#fff">Strategy 1</text>
  <text x="375" y="30" font-family="Arial, sans-serif" font-size="14" text-anchor="middle" fill="#fff">Strategy 2</text>
  <text x="525" y="30" font-family="Arial, sans-serif" font-size="14" text-anchor="middle" fill="#fff">Strategy 3</text>
  
  <!--

content.text:
Certainly, I'd be happy to review the description of the diagrams and create them for you. Let me summarize the key points for each diagram and then create them one by one.

1. Integrated Framework Diagram

This is a multi-layered circular diagram with three main components:
- Center Circle: Self-Efficacy
- Middle Ring: 12 Strategies for Developing Self-Efficacy
- Outer Ring: Connections to PTG and Related Concepts

Let's create this diagram:

<antThinking>Creating a multi-layered circular diagram is a good candidate for an artifact. It's a complex, self-contained visual element that can be understood on its own and might be used in various contexts. This is a new request, so I'll create a new artifact with the identifier "integrated-framework-diagram".</antThinking>

<antArtifact identifier="integrated-framework-diagram" type="image/svg+xml" title="Integrated Framework Diagram">
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 500 500">
  <!-- Outer ring -->
  <circle cx="250" cy="250" r="240" fill="#e6f3ff" stroke="#333" stroke-width="2"/>
  
  <!-- Middle ring -->
  <circle cx="250" cy="250" r="160" fill="#b3d9ff" stroke="#333" stroke-width="2"/>
  
  <!-- Inner circle -->
  <circle cx="250" cy="250" r="80" fill="#4da6ff" stroke="#333" stroke-width="2"/>
  
  <!-- Center text -->
  <text x="250" y="260" font-family="Arial, sans-serif" font-size="20" text-anchor="middle" fill="#333">Self-Efficacy</text>
  
  <!-- Middle ring text -->
  <g font-family="Arial, sans-serif" font-size="10" fill="#333">
    <text x="250" y="100" text-anchor="middle" transform="rotate(-75 250 250)">Integrate Self-Efficacy</text>
    <text x="250" y="100" text-anchor="middle" transform="rotate(-45 250 250)">Offer Mastery Experiences</text>
    <text x="250" y="100" text-anchor="middle" transform="rotate(-15 250 250)">Foster Collaborative Learning</text>
    <text x="250" y="100" text-anchor="middle" transform="rotate(15 250 250)">Provide Feedback</text>
    <text x="250" y="100" text-anchor="middle" transform="rotate(45 250 250)">Incorporate Goal Setting</text>
    <text x="250" y="100" text-anchor="middle" transform="rotate(75 250 250)">Model Self-Efficacy</text>
    <text x="250" y="400" text-anchor="middle" transform="rotate(-75 250 250)">Create Positive Environment</text>
    <text x="250" y="400" text-anchor="middle" transform="rotate(-45 250 250)">Utilize Micro-Moments</text>
    <text x="250" y="400" text-anchor="middle" transform="rotate(-15 250 250)">Encourage Growth Mindset</text>
    <text x="250" y="400" text-anchor="middle" transform="rotate(15 250 250)">Integrate Reflection</text>
    <text x="250" y="400" text-anchor="middle" transform="rotate(45 250 250)">Student Leadership</text>
    <text x="250" y="400" text-anchor="middle" transform="rotate(75 250 250)">Leverage Technology</text>
  </g>
  
  <!-- Outer ring text -->
  <g font-family="Arial, sans-serif" font-size="12" fill="#333">
    <text x="250" y="20" text-anchor="middle">Resilience</text>
    <text x="480" y="250" text-anchor="middle">Deliberate Rumination</text>
    <text x="250" y="480" text-anchor="middle">Gratitude</text>
    <text x="20" y="250" text-anchor="middle">Social Support</text>
    <text x="100" y="100" text-anchor="middle">Narrative Reappraisal</text>
    <text x="400" y="100" text-anchor="middle">Brutally Honest Optimism</text>
    <text x="400" y="400" text-anchor="middle">Perceived Control</text>
    <text x="100" y="400" text-anchor="middle">Coping Style</text>
  </g>
  
  <!-- Connecting lines -->
  <g stroke="#333" stroke-width="1">
    <line x1="250" y1="90" x2="250" y2="170"/>
    <line x1="250" y1="330" x2="250" y2="410"/>
    <line x1="90" y1="250" x2="170" y2="250"/>
    <line x1="330" y1="250" x2="410" y2="250"/>
    <line x1="180" y1="180" x2="230" y2="230"/>
    <line x1="320" y1="180" x2="270" y2="230"/>
    <line x1="320" y1="320" x2="270" y2="270"/>
    <line x1="180" y1="320" x2="230" y2="270"/>
  </g>
</svg>
</antArtifact>

This diagram visualizes the Integrated Framework, showing how self-efficacy is at the center, surrounded by strategies for developing it, and how these connect to PTG-related concepts.

2. Strategy Implementation Flowchart

This is a flowchart with decision points, showing:
- Starting Point: Curriculum Goals
- Branches for Each Strategy
- Decision Nodes
- Process Steps
- Outcomes

Let's create this flowchart:

<antThinking>A flowchart is another good candidate for an artifact. It's a complex, self-contained visual element that can be understood on its own and might be used in various contexts. This is a new request, so I'll create a new artifact with the identifier "strategy-implementation-flowchart".</antThinking>

<antArtifact identifier="strategy-implementation-flowchart" type="image/svg+xml" title="Strategy Implementation Flowchart">
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 600 400">
  <!-- Start node -->
  <rect x="250" y="10" width="100" height="50" rx="10" fill="#4da6ff" stroke="#333" stroke-width="2"/>
  <text x="300" y="40" font-family="Arial, sans-serif" font-size="12" text-anchor="middle" fill="#fff">Curriculum Goals</text>
  
  <!-- Decision node -->
  <polygon points="300,80 340,120 300,160 260,120" fill="#ffd966" stroke="#333" stroke-width="2"/>
  <text x="300" y="125" font-family="Arial, sans-serif" font-size="10" text-anchor="middle">Students struggling with confidence?</text>
  
  <!-- Yes branch -->
  <rect x="100" y="180" width="120" height="60" rx="10" fill="#b6d7a8" stroke="#333" stroke-width="2"/>
  <text x="160" y="210" font-family="Arial, sans-serif" font-size="10" text-anchor="middle">Implement scaffolding for complex tasks</text>
  
  <!-- No branch -->
  <rect x="380" y="180" width="120" height="60" rx="10" fill="#b6d7a8" stroke="#333" stroke-width="2"/>
  <text x="440" y="210" font-family="Arial, sans-serif" font-size="10" text-anchor="middle">Foster collaborative learning</text>
  
  <!-- Outcome -->

  <text x="300" y="325" font-family="Arial, sans-serif" font-size="12" text-anchor="middle" fill="#fff">Enhanced Self-Efficacy</text>
  
  <!-- Arrows -->

    <path d="M300,60 L300,80"/>
    <path d="M260,120 L100,120 L100,180"/>
    <path d="M340,120 L500,120 L500,180"/>
    <path d="M160,240 L160,280 L250,280 L250,300"/>
    <path d="M440,240 L440,280 L350,280 L350,300"/>

  <text x="400" y="115" font-family="Arial, sans-serif" font-size="12" fill="#333">No</text>
</svg>
</antArtifact>

This flowchart illustrates the decision-making process for implementing strategies based on student needs, leading to enhanced self-efficacy.

<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 400 400">
  <!-- Triangle -->
  <polygon points="200,50 50,350 350,350" fill="#e6f3ff" stroke="#333" stroke-width="2"/>

  <!-- Vertex labels -->
  <text x="200" y="55" font-family="Arial, sans-serif" font-size="12" text-anchor="middle" fill="#333">Personal Factors</text>
  <text x="50" y="355" font-family="Arial, sans-serif" font-size="12" text-anchor="middle" fill="#333">Behavior</text>
  <text x="350" y="355" font-family="Arial, sans-serif" font-size="12" text-anchor="middle" fill="#333">Environmental Factors</text>
  
  <!-- Center label -->

  <!-- Bidirectional arrows -->

    <path d="M190,90 L70,310"/>
    <path d="M210,90 L330,310"/>
    <path d="M90,350 L310,350"/>
  </g>
  
  <!-- Arrow definitions -->

      <polygon points="0 0, 10 3.5, 0 7" fill="#333"/>
    </marker>
  </defs>
  
  <!-- PTG connections -->
  <g stroke="#ff7f50" stroke-width="1" stroke-dasharray="5,5">
    <line x1="200" y1="50" x2="200" y2="200"/>
    <line x1="50" y1="350" x2="150" y2="250"/>
    <line x1="350" y1="350" x2="250" y2="250"/>
  </g>
  
  <!-- PTG labels -->
  <text x="220" y="125" font-family="Arial, sans-serif" font-size="10" fill="#ff7f50">Gratitude</text>
  <text x="100" y="275" font-family="Arial, sans-serif" font-size="10" fill="#ff7f50">Coping Style</text>
  <text x="300" y="275" font-family="Arial, sans-serif" font-size="10" fill="#ff7f50">Social Support</text>
</svg>
</antArtifact>

This triangle model illustrates the reciprocal relationships between personal factors, behavior, and environmental factors, with self-efficacy at the center and connections to PTG factors.
